attributes.action: stop over-charging graduates who go on to study medicine
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
people from poorer backgrounds often under-perform up until a-level. often the only chance these people have of getting into med-school is through graduate entry. dont charge graduate entry into med-school as a "second degree" when it is the only route into the career for some.

make it so that the only barriers to studying medicine are intelligence and proof of commitment...

we are pricing some of the best doctors out of the profession.

also many countries only accept graduates into med-school, dont rush 18 year olds into such a life changing decision with an "its now or never" attitude.

the choice is, do we want young, ambitious, rich doctors or good ones?
